page.title: 12Claygate Hamlet
page.content:
Seventy years ago Claygate hamlet had a general store and a blacksmith's shop. In more recent years the store had three vans which provided for outlying farms, and provided employment for seven people in all. The shop closed in 1958 and it and the blacksmith's are now dwellings.
Claygate also had its own school at Gilnockie, but this closed in 1978 and the children were sent to the school in Canonbie village. There are at present only three children of primary school age in the hamlet and surrounding area.
There was also a station on the Carlisle to Langholm branch line but this is also a dwelling now. Apart from farms there is no employment of any sort in Claygate.
